DataElement.preferredName: Trail Making Test First Part Discontinue Reason Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the reason the neurocognitive evaluation Trail Making Test Part A was stopped or not started, permanently or temporarily.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Trail Making Test First Part Discontinue Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Concepts.definition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
